course.subject: MATH
course.name: Applied Analysis
course.description: The aim of the course is to provide an introduction to the analysis which are used frequently in applications. The topics includes: contraction mapping theory, Banach space and Hilbert space, fourier series and fourier transform, spectrum of bounded linear operators, convex analysis, differential calculus and variational methods. For each topic, we shall introduce a variety of examples from different fields to motivate and demonstrate the ideas. We shall keep the presentation as simple as possible, but without sacrificing the mathematical rigour. Students without course prerequisite should seek instructor's approval to take the course.
course.prerequisites: (MATH 1014 OR MATH 1018 OR MATH 1020 OR MATH1024) AND (MATH 2111 OR MATH 2121 OR MATH 2131) AND (MATH 2350 OR MATH 2351 OR MATH 2352)
